who wouldn't respect that?

2004-04-14

Reminder: people like this do exist.

"It's a challenge," said Dave Solwold, explaining the lure of joining the US Marine Corps.

"They mould you into something everybody respects."

The 18-year-old, clad in long shorts and sneakers, wants a career as a military lawyer, but is aware he could be called up to fight in Iraq if he completes his basic training in time.

It's a prospect he relishes. "You just want to pick up a gun and go down there and go crazy," he said, expressing exasperation and indignation at the attacks on US forces in Iraq.

"We're trying to help them out but a lot of them don't seem to understand that."

http://www.smh.com.au/articles/2004/04/14/1081838761977.html
